Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two plants: one plant with water and one without water.
The student can show in their drawing the effect of having water on the plant, such as healthy growth and vibrant color.
The student can illustrate the effect of not having water on the plant, such as wilting or brown leaves.
The student can use the drawing to show that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can identify patterns between plants with water and plants without water based on their drawings.
